title: Ticket #107: PrivSep: Switchboard's mkdir operation doesn't clean up when it fails
description:
The PrivSwp Switchboard has a "mkdir" operation that allows Condor to create job sandbox directories in the EXECUTE directory (which is modifiable only by root in PrivSep mode). Creation of a directory occurs in two steps.

  1. Create the directory as root.
  2. Use chown() to give the directory the correct ownership.

If a problem occurs and the operation fails, it can leave behind the root-owned directory created in step 1.

As part of looking at this issue I'd like to reconsider whether root-ownership of the EXECUTE directory is strictly needed. If not, we could do away with the Switchboard mkdir operation altogether.
